paragraphs.text:
%md

This notebook is my personal Python kitchensink , it uses Python 3.4 within Zeppelin

msg.data: This notebook is my personal Python kitchensink , it uses Python 3.4 within Zeppelin

paragraphs.title: Create remote python module for test purpose only , so we can import it
paragraphs.text:
%sh
echo "class Otherclass:" > otherclass.py
echo "  def __init__(self,x,y):" >> otherclass.py
echo "     print('In Otherclass constructor')" >> otherclass.py
cat otherclass.py

''' This is my Python kitchensink. Describe all components in the current file '''

#In zeppelin the notebook is seperate from our shell output, so we can only import our module using absolute path. (python 3.4 only)
from importlib.machinery import SourceFileLoader
somefile = SourceFileLoader("Otherclass", "/usr/zeppelin/otherclass.py").load_module()

#Normal import, use this:  from otherclass import Otherclass ("as alias" optionally) . Never use import * as it bad practise. Use from <File> import Class1, Class2 to load multiple

class Point:
    '''Put your class description here and how to use it'''
    def __init__(self, x, y):
        '''Describe X and Y . Make sure to create a constructor to init required parameters, or call required methods'''
        self.move(x, y, "Beginning")
        self.protect("donottell")
        
        #Call our remote class. In this case the file load class is required.
        other = somefile.Otherclass(4,5)

    def protect (self,some_secret="password"):
        '''Save the parameter as hidden private property'''
        self.__some_secret = some_secret  #__property should be seen as private, but is not really!
        
    def move(self, x, y,some_text="Default text"):
        '''Documentation for each component should be added. some_text is optional due to default value''' 
        self.x = x
        self.y = y
        
        class DefaultFormatter:
            '''Format a string in title case. Inline class within a function'''
            def format(self, string):
                return str(string).title()
        
        formatter = DefaultFormatter().format(some_text)
        print("Move output:" + formatter)
    
    def reset(self):
        '''All methods should at least have 1 argument point to itself'''
        self.move(0, 0, "Resetting")

class Database:
    ''' This will be a future class'''
    pass
    
def main():
    '''main entry point of our program. Automatically called at startup'''
    point = Point(3, 5)
    print(point.x, point.y)
    print ("secret: " + point._Point__some_secret)  #hmm it shows

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

#As we are in Zeppelin we have to execute it manually
main()

paragraphs.title: Virtual env
paragraphs.text:
%sh

cd $HOME
python -m venv env
source env/bin/activate  # on Linux or MacOS
#env/bin/activate.bat     # on Windows

paragraphs.title: Package (folder structure)
paragraphs.text:
%md

```
#In zeppelin packages is not very usable, its more for bigger projects using IDE's 

#Absolute imports in current package
from ecommerce.products import Product
product = Product()

#Relative import
from .database import Database
from ..database import Database  #In parent package use database.py 's Database class
```

msg.data:
#In zeppelin packages is not very usable, its more for bigger projects using IDE's 

#Absolute imports in current package
from ecommerce.products import Product
product = Product()

#Relative import
from .database import Database
from ..database import Database  #In parent package use database.py 's Database class
